Detailed Description

Definitions for PPU-side simple linked list module (thread-safe version, just a very naive implementation).

Define Documentation

#define __ctk_list_iterate ( l,
x   ) 

Value:

for ((x) = CTK_LIST_ITEM_PTR(CTK_LIST_PTR(l)->head); \
       (x) != NULL; \
       (x) = CTK_LIST_ITEM_PTR(((ctk_list_item_t*)(x))->next))

#define __ctk_list_iterate_ea ( l,
ea   ) 

Value:

for ((ea) = CTK_LIST_PTR(l)->head; (ea) != 0;  \
        (ea) = ((ctk_list_item_t*)(ea))->next)

#define CTK_LIST_EA ( list   )     ((ctk_list_ea_t)(unsigned long)(&list))

A macro to get a list reference for the given list.

#define ctk_list_iterate ( l,
type,
x   ) 

Value:

for ((x) = (type)CTK_LIST_ITEM_PTR(CTK_LIST_PTR(l)->head); \
       (x) != NULL; \
       (x) = (type)CTK_LIST_ITEM_PTR(((ctk_list_item_t*)(x))->next))

list reference type

typedef ea_addr_t ctk_list_item_ea_t

list item reference type

typedef struct ctk_list_item ctk_list_item_t

list item structure ('abstract' structure; the user-defined list item structure must have the 'next' and 'backing' member variables (of ea_addr_t) as the first elements of the structure.)
